page.title: 02GEOGRAPHY OF GLADESTRY AREA
page.content: The area we live in is hilly. The hills are not very high. The Yew Tree Bank is 1000 feet high. We have more hills in the block. Cefn Hir is 1675 feet high. Burl Hill is 1402 feet high. The hills are smooth. The rock is shale. It breaks very easily. Tractors can be driven up some hills but other hills are too steep. Some valleys are very wide but some are very narrow. We have two brooks, Penfaen Brook and Gilwern Brook. They are small because we are near the source of the streams. There are several dingles. A dingle is a valley. A dingle is steep and narrow. Orrell grows in a dingle. Orrell is a tree which is usually called alder. Dingles usually have a stream at the bottom.
